channel.title: Tor Messenger on Whonix
channel.description: Will the new [b]Tor Messenger[/b] beta play well with Whonix? https://blog.torproject.org/blog/tor-messenger-beta-chat-over-tor-easily Are there plans to integrate this into Whonix? I'm guessing we will have to wait until it's out of beta for that. Until then, are there reccomended settings? I tried it on Windows and it installed a Tor client.

item.title: Tor Messenger on Whonix
item.dc:creator: tempest
item.description:
as some of you may be aware, there is a relatively nasty bug involving tor messenger and kde that causes a random crash if one clicks on any of the menus in the contact list window. there is a fix that i missed mentioned in one of the bug tickets on the tor bug tracker which seems to be working fine.

open a terminal and type “sudo apt-get install qtcurve”. then click on the k start button, select “system settings” and then double click on “application appearance.” in the pulldown window next to “widget style,” select “qtcurve.” Then, click the apply button and close the system settings window.

qtcurve is a theme package to bridge issues between gnome and kde themes. since doing this, i have yet to experience a single crash in tor messenger.

Read full topic

item.title: Tor Messenger on Whonix
item.dc:creator: Patrick
item.description:
whonixbest:

I downloaded the tor messenger, but I can not download the checksums, I click on the link and the file is not downloaded but just opens. In the messenger there is no plugin otr

Please ask Tor Project about it as per https://www.whonix.org/wiki/Free_Support_Principle.

Read full topic

Have a nice day,

Ego
